mainEntity.name: What battery do I need for my golf cart?

acceptedAnswer.text: Cart Battery Depot offers golf cart batteries in 6V, 8V, and 12V configurations. The most popular is our 6V 225Ah system. Call 1-844-888-7732 for personalized recommendations based on your specific cart model and usage needs.

mainEntity.name: How long do golf cart batteries last?

acceptedAnswer.text: Battery lifespan varies by technology: Flooded batteries last 3-5 years, AGM batteries 4-6 years, Gel batteries 4-7 years, and Lithium batteries 8-10+ years with proper maintenance.

mainEntity.name: What's the difference between AGM and Flooded batteries?

acceptedAnswer.text: Flooded batteries are traditional, proven technology requiring regular maintenance (water refilling) but are most economical. AGM (Absorbed Glass Mat) batteries are completely maintenance-free, spill-proof, and more resistant to vibration, but cost more upfront.

mainEntity.name: Can I mix different battery types in my golf cart?

acceptedAnswer.text: No, mixing battery types is not recommended. Always use identical batteries (same voltage, capacity, technology, and preferably age) in your battery bank for optimal performance and longevity.

mainEntity.name: Do you offer battery installation services?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Cart Battery Depot offers professional installation services for $200. We also provide detailed installation guides and phone support for self-installation. Call 1-844-888-7732 to schedule.
Core charges are refundable deposits that encourage battery recycling. The charge is $29 for 6V/8V batteries and $57 for 12V batteries. Return your old batteries to receive the full refund.

mainEntity.name: How many batteries does a golf cart need?

acceptedAnswer.text: It depends on your voltage system: 36V systems use 6 x 6V batteries, 48V systems use 8 x 6V, 6 x 8V, or 4 x 12V batteries, and 72V systems use 6 x 12V batteries.

mainEntity.name: Are lithium golf cart batteries worth the investment?

acceptedAnswer.text: Lithium batteries offer significant advantages: 50% lighter weight, 8-10+ year lifespan, faster charging, and zero maintenance. While they have higher upfront cost, they often provide better long-term value for frequent users.
